TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RoleGroup extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Associates a content template in a control with one or more roles defined for the Web site. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to define a set of content templates that contain the content that is displayed to Web site users based on the role assigned by Web site administrators. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> class is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control to associate a content template with a set of roles.
To dynamically assign a template to the role group, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContentTemplate%2A> property to a reference to an object that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> interface.
You must configure role management to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup> class. For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0d2f19d-a2a7-496d-88b6-30133f8ea3d6).
## Examples The following code example assigns a custom template to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContentTemplate%2A> property.
[!code-aspx-csharp[RoleGroupClass#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/RoleGroupClass/CS/rolegroupclasscs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[RoleGroupClass#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/RoleGroupClass/VB/rolegroupclassvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ContainsUser(class System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal user) cil managed
Public Function ContainsUser (user As IPrincipal) As Boolean

Docs.param: The user name to look for in the role group.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the specified user is a member of any of the roles in the role group.
Docs.returns: if the user is a member of one of the roles associated with this role group; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContainsUser%2A> method returns `true` if the specified user is a member of any of the roles associated with this role group. Roles are searched in the order they are listed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.Roles%2A> property, and searching stops after the first match is found.
This method uses the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.IsUserInRole%2A> method to determine whether a user is a member of a role. You must configure role management to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContainsUser%2A> method. For more information, see [Understanding Role Management](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0d2f19d-a2a7-496d-88b6-30133f8ea3d6).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content template associated with this role group.
Docs.value: The associated with this role group. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ContentTemplate%2A> property contains the content that is displayed to users who are members of this role group.
## Examples The following code example dynamically creates a content template.

Docs.summary: Returns a comma-separated list of the roles associated with this role group.
Docs.returns: A comma-separated list of the roles associated with this role group.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.ToString%2A> method returns the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RoleGroup.Roles%2A> property as a comma-separated list of roles associated with the role group.
